page.title: 06THE COASTGUARD
page.content: This stretch of coast is the responsibility of the coastguard whose area covers Montrose to the Borders. The cliffs in this area are used as a training ground for auxilliary officers, especially in the use of rescue apparatus. Not only do they practise cliff rescues but they also use the area for coastal searches. Coastguards are called out rarely, although emergency calls peak in the summer months with the advent of holiday makers:scuba divers, lilos and small boats cause most trouble. The coastal walk has also caused some problems, as the area is now freely accessible to the public, yet poses access problems for vehicles when help is needed, and the coastguard has to rely on farm tracks leading close to the shore. In dire emergency, R.A.F. helicopters are close at hand.
